text.meeting_minutes:
Overall Focus
The conversation centers around the development and implementation of holographic technology for business and military applications, including updates on project status, coordination among various stakeholders, and potential use cases.
Identified Speakers and Roles
Speaker-1: Unidentified, minimal contribution.
Speaker-2: Likely a project manager or coordinator, facilitating the discussion and ensuring follow-ups.
Speaker-3: Involved in business development for Holographics.
Speaker-4: Wally Haws, associated with Holographics.
Speaker-5: Technical expert or lead, transitioning to new markets but still involved in the project.
Summary of Relevant Details
Introduction and Identification
Speaker-2 introduces Troy Clark and mentions the development of a tool with a university's applied machine learning lab.
Speaker-3 and Speaker-4 identify their roles in Holographics.
Project Updates
Speaker-3 mentions a recent meeting with Alan and Nita regarding the status of the crater project.
Speaker-3 notes a change in the definition of small business in the US code to NAICS, which Nita will check with legal.
Speaker-3 states that Alan will get letters from Port Wyoming and Corona to confirm the facility security officer's authorization.
Coordination and Next Steps
Speaker-3 and Speaker-2 discuss internal coordination for the security office.
Speaker-3 outlines the need for emails to ensure all documentation is ready for the US trade representative.
Speaker-5 talks about planning the first project and use case, mentioning the need for prototype testing and a kickoff meeting.
Speaker-5 mentions a new facility at UCF Florida with a Novak table by the end of the year.
Use Cases and Technical Details
Speaker-2 suggests ballistic missile reconstruction analysis as a potential use case.
Speaker-5 proposes involving Michael Clark from Dahl Rant for additional perspective.
Speaker-2 and Speaker-4 discuss using notional data for 3D reconstruction and the possibility of porting it to their system.
Facilities and Logistics
Speaker-4 mentions having a Novak in St. John's and plans for another in Silicon Valley.
Speaker-2 inquires about the location in Silicon Valley, which is still to be determined.
Data Visualization and Future Work
Speaker-2 and Speaker-4 discuss the potential for data visualization in holography, including cyber domain and spatial data.
Speaker-5 mentions support for Unreal Engine and Unity for data-based work.
Speaker-2 suggests reimagining data visualization through holography.
Conclusion and Follow-ups
Speaker-4 emphasizes the need to reestablish face-to-face meetings and provide updates on the crater project.
Speaker-2 acknowledges the importance of the joint crater and the need to get it through the foci.
Speaker-5 and Speaker-4 discuss the progress and coordination with Alan and Anita.
Speaker-2 plans to pull together teams and subject matter experts for further collaboration.
Speaker-5 suggests revisiting the ASI data visualization project for quick turnaround and demonstration.
Closing Remarks
Speaker-2 wraps up the meeting, indicating they will send a copy of the discussion to the participants.
text.recommendations:
Action Items

Coordinate Internal Security Office
   - Assigned to: Speaker-2
   - Details: Work internally to ensure the security office is aligned with the project requirements.
   - Resources: https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework

Confirm Legal Changes with Nita
   - Assigned to: Speaker-3
   - Details: Verify the change from US code to NAICS with legal.
   - Resources: https://www.census.gov/naics/

Obtain Authorization Letters
   - Assigned to: Alan (via Speaker-3)
   - Details: Secure letters from Port Wyoming and Corona confirming the facility security officer's authorization.
   - Resources: https://www.cdse.edu/Training/Security-Training-Catalog/Facility-Security-Officer.html

Prepare Documentation for US Trade Representative
   - Assigned to: Speaker-3
   - Details: Ensure all necessary documentation is ready for submission.
   - Resources: https://ustr.gov/

Plan Kickoff Meeting
   - Assigned to: Speaker-5
   - Details: Organize a kickoff meeting to discuss the first project and use case.
   - Resources: https://www.projectmanager.com/blog/project-kickoff-meeting

Coordinate with UCF Florida Facility
   - Assigned to: Speaker-5
   - Details: Plan for the use of the new Novak table at UCF Florida.
   - Resources: https://www.research.ucf.edu/

Develop Ballistic Missile Reconstruction Analysis Use Case
   - Assigned to: Speaker-2 and Speaker-4
   - Details: Flesh out the use case for ballistic missile reconstruction analysis.
   - Resources: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0097849318300321

Involve Michael Clark for Additional Perspective
   - Assigned to: Speaker-5
   - Details: Bring Michael Clark into the project for his technical insights.
   - Resources: https://hbr.org/2015/12/collaborative-overload

Port Notional Data for 3D Reconstruction
   - Assigned to: Speaker-2 and Speaker-4
   - Details: Transfer notional data to the holographic system for testing.
   - Resources: https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/17452759.2019.1628044

Reestablish Face-to-Face Meetings
    - Assigned to: Speaker-4
    - Details: Schedule and conduct face-to-face meetings to update on project status.
    - Resources: https://www.mindtools.com/CommSkll/RunningMeetings.htm

Explore Data Visualization in Holography
    - Assigned to: Speaker-2 and Speaker-4
    - Details: Investigate the potential for data visualization using holographic technology.
    - Resources: https://www.tableau.com/learn/articles/data-visualization

Follow Up on ASI Data Visualization Project
    - Assigned to: Speaker-5
    - Details: Revisit the ASI data visualization project for quick demonstration.
    - Resources: https://www.asi.com/solutions/data-visualization/
Recommended Resources

NIST Cybersecurity Framework: https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework
NAICS Code Information: https://www.census.gov/naics/
Facility Security Officer Guidelines: https://www.cdse.edu/Training/Security-Training-Catalog/Facility-Security-Officer.html
U.S. Trade Representative: https://ustr.gov/
Project Kickoff Meeting Guide: https://www.projectmanager.com/blog/project-kickoff-meeting
University of Central Florida Research Facilities: https://www.research.ucf.edu/
Holographic Data Visualization: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0097849318300321
Technical Collaboration Best Practices: https://hbr.org/2015/12/collaborative-overload
3D Data Reconstruction Techniques: https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/17452759.2019.1628044
Effective Meeting Strategies: https://www.mindtools.com/CommSkll/RunningMeetings.htm
Data Visualization Techniques: https://www.tableau.com/learn/articles/data-visualization
ASI Data Visualization: https://www.asi.com/solutions/data-visualization/

markdown.meeting_minutes:
### Overall Focus
The conversation centers around the development and implementation of holographic technology for business and military applications, including updates on project status, coordination among various stakeholders, and potential use cases.

### Identified Speakers and Roles
- **Speaker-1**: Unidentified, minimal contribution.
- **Speaker-2**: Likely a project manager or coordinator, facilitating the discussion and ensuring follow-ups.
- **Speaker-3**: Involved in business development for Holographics.
- **Speaker-4**: Wally Haws, associated with Holographics.
- **Speaker-5**: Technical expert or lead, transitioning to new markets but still involved in the project.

### Summary of Relevant Details

#### Introduction and Identification
- **Speaker-2** introduces Troy Clark and mentions the development of a tool with a university's applied machine learning lab.
- **Speaker-3** and **Speaker-4** identify their roles in Holographics.

#### Project Updates
- **Speaker-3** mentions a recent meeting with Alan and Nita regarding the status of the crater project.
- **Speaker-3** notes a change in the definition of small business in the US code to NAICS, which Nita will check with legal.
- **Speaker-3** states that Alan will get letters from Port Wyoming and Corona to confirm the facility security officer's authorization.

#### Coordination and Next Steps
- **Speaker-3** and **Speaker-2** discuss internal coordination for the security office.
- **Speaker-3** outlines the need for emails to ensure all documentation is ready for the US trade representative.
- **Speaker-5** talks about planning the first project and use case, mentioning the need for prototype testing and a kickoff meeting.
- **Speaker-5** mentions a new facility at UCF Florida with a Novak table by the end of the year.

#### Use Cases and Technical Details
- **Speaker-2** suggests ballistic missile reconstruction analysis as a potential use case.
- **Speaker-5** proposes involving Michael Clark from Dahl Rant for additional perspective.
- **Speaker-2** and **Speaker-4** discuss using notional data for 3D reconstruction and the possibility of porting it to their system.

#### Facilities and Logistics
- **Speaker-4** mentions having a Novak in St. John's and plans for another in Silicon Valley.
- **Speaker-2** inquires about the location in Silicon Valley, which is still to be determined.

#### Data Visualization and Future Work
- **Speaker-2** and **Speaker-4** discuss the potential for data visualization in holography, including cyber domain and spatial data.
- **Speaker-5** mentions support for Unreal Engine and Unity for data-based work.
- **Speaker-2** suggests reimagining data visualization through holography.

#### Conclusion and Follow-ups
- **Speaker-4** emphasizes the need to reestablish face-to-face meetings and provide updates on the crater project.
- **Speaker-2** acknowledges the importance of the joint crater and the need to get it through the foci.
- **Speaker-5** and **Speaker-4** discuss the progress and coordination with Alan and Anita.
- **Speaker-2** plans to pull together teams and subject matter experts for further collaboration.
- **Speaker-5** suggests revisiting the ASI data visualization project for quick turnaround and demonstration.

### Closing Remarks
- **Speaker-2** wraps up the meeting, indicating they will send a copy of the discussion to the participants.

10. **Reestablish Face-to-Face Meetings**
    - **Assigned to:** Speaker-4
    - **Details:** Schedule and conduct face-to-face meetings to update on project status.
    - **Resources:** [Effective Meeting Strategies](https://www.mindtools.com/CommSkll/RunningMeetings.htm)

11. **Explore Data Visualization in Holography**
    - **Assigned to:** Speaker-2 and Speaker-4
    - **Details:** Investigate the potential for data visualization using holographic technology.
    - **Resources:** [Data Visualization Techniques](https://www.tableau.com/learn/articles/data-visualization)

12. **Follow Up on ASI Data Visualization Project**
    - **Assigned to:** Speaker-5
    - **Details:** Revisit the ASI data visualization project for quick demonstration.
    - **Resources:** [ASI Data Visualization](https://www.asi.com/solutions/data-visualization/)
